titles.title: To extend the authority of the Los Angeles Unified School District to use certain park lands in the city of South Gate, California, which were acquired with amounts provided from the land and water conservation fund, for elementary school purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5083.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Hansen objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 7/27/2000--Introduced. Extends the authority of the Los Angeles Unified School District to use, for elementary school purposes, certain park lands in the City of South Gate, California, which were acquired with amounts provided from the land and water conservation fund.Directs the President of the Board of Education for the Los Angeles Unified School District to require periodic reports on: (1) progress in relocating Tweedy Elementary School from South Gate Park to a permanent location; and (2) the School District's construction plans for a new high school, middle school, and three primary centers in South Gate.
